Package application

Class Blocks

java.lang.Object
application.Blocks
public class Blocks
extends java.lang.Object
Creates and runs a back end base for the game to run on
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Tyler Marefke

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Blocks()
    Sets up the block class arrays and creates the first block of the game

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int BlockMoveDown()
    Shifts the movable block down one row
    void BlockMoveLeft()
    Shifts the movable block to the left one column
    void BlockMoveRight()
    Shifts the movable block to the right one column
    boolean BlockToStationary()
    Changes the numbers on the board to negative in order to remove the movement of that block
    void CreateBlock()
    Randomly generates a key code for the block to create and creates a block according to those specifications.
    void DeleteCurrentNextBlock()
    Removes the previous contents of the next block array
    void DeleteRow()
    Deletes the rows that have been completely filled in the board
    void displayGrid()
    Displays a text based grid for testing purposes
    void GenerateNextBlock()
    Generates a block for the next block section in the game
    int[][] getNextBlockGridBackground()
    Returns the text based array of the nextBlock array
    int getNumRowsDeleted()
    Returns the number of rows deleted in the board
    int[][] getTetrisGridBackground()
    Returns the text based array of the tetris game
    void RotateBlockKey​(boolean rotateRightLeft)
    Takes the in the rotation of left or right and finds the correct block to rotate
    void RotateLeftLBlock​(boolean rotateCode)
    Allows the Left L block to be rotated
    void RotateLeftZBlock​(boolean rotateCode)
    Allows the Left Z block to be rotated
    void RotateLineBlock​(boolean rotateCode)
    Allows the Straight Line block to be rotated
    void RotateRightLBlock​(boolean rotateCode)
    Allows the Right L block to be rotated
    void RotateRightZBlock​(boolean rotateCode)
    Allows the Right Z block to be rotated
    void RotateTBlock​(boolean rotateCode)
    Allows the T block to be rotated
    void ShiftBoardDown​(int myRowPos)
    Shifts the board down once a row has been cleared
